summary: H. Clark Schor is mentioned in three memoranda from January 1978. All three documents are addressed from Schor to SA/DO/O and provide additional information in response to a request from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Schor's role appears to be related to providing information from the Central Cover Staff (CCS) regarding individuals and entities of interest to the HSCA, detailing the types and quantity of documents held by the CCS on each.
significance: H. Clark Schor's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in their role as a point of contact within the Central Cover Staff (CCS) for providing information to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). They were responsible for gathering and disseminating information about individuals and organizations of interest to the HSCA investigation.
